the difference with 'netstat -rn' and 'route' is that netstat -rn won't try and reverse-lookup the names on the IPs.
usefull to know
try this: 'route' and then type 'netstat -r' and compare the results
and then try 'netstat -rn' and you'll see what I mean.  I prefer it without the names and instead just the IPs
Its the same, is it an alias in bash?
not an alias, just a different command.  Identical results, though.  It's faster when it doesn't have to do a lookup, however.
